title: Provides for the provision of voter registration forms to students by colleges, universities and public high schools
summary: Provides for the provision of voter registration forms to students by colleges, universities and public high schools.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          542

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by Sens. KLEIN, BRESLIN, DIAZ, DILAN, HASSELL-THOMPSON, HUNT-
         LEY, KRUEGER, MONTGOMERY, OPPENHEIMER, SAMPSON, STAVISKY -- read twice
         and ordered printed, and when printed to be committed to the Committee
         on Elections

       AN  ACT to amend the election law, in relation to voter registration and
         enrollment

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Section  5-211 of the election law is amended by adding a
    2  new subdivision 18 to read as follows:
    3    18. ALL COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES AND PUBLIC HIGH SCHOOLS LOCATED IN THIS
    4  STATE SHALL MAKE VOTER REGISTRATION  FORMS  AVAILABLE  TO  ANY  ELIGIBLE
    5  STUDENTS IN THE SAME MANNER AND SUBJECT TO THE SAME PROVISIONS AND RULES
    6  AND REGULATIONS AS ALL OTHER DESIGNATED AGENCIES; EXCEPT THAT A COLLEGE,
    7  UNIVERSITY  OR  PUBLIC  HIGH  SCHOOL SHALL NOT BE REQUIRED TO COLLECT OR
    8  MAINTAIN FORMS CONTAINING AN INDIVIDUAL'S  DECLINATION  TO  REGISTER  TO
    9  VOTE  AS  REQUIRED  BY  SUBDIVISION TEN OF THIS SECTION, OR TO CONDUCT A
   10  STUDY AND REPORT THEREON AS REQUIRED BY SUBDIVISION  SEVENTEEN  OF  THIS
   11  SECTION.
   12    EACH  COLLEGE,  UNIVERSITY  AND  PUBLIC HIGH SCHOOL SHALL PROVIDE EACH
   13  ELIGIBLE STUDENT WITH A REGISTRATION FORM WITHIN THE FIRST  THREE  WEEKS
   14  OF  SUCH  STUDENT'S  ENTRY  TO  SCHOOL  OR ARRIVAL ON CAMPUS PURSUANT TO
   15  SUBDIVISIONS TWO, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, SEVEN,  NINE,  ELEVEN,  TWELVE  AND
   16  FIFTEEN  OF  THIS  SECTION.  EVERY  COLLEGE,  UNIVERSITY AND PUBLIC HIGH
   17  SCHOOL SHALL DESIGNATE AT LEAST ONE CONVENIENTLY  LOCATED  OFFICE  WHERE
   18  STUDENTS MAY RECEIVE VOTER REGISTRATION FORMS AND PERSONAL ASSISTANCE IN
   19  THE COMPLETION OF SUCH FORMS. EACH SUCH OFFICE SHALL PUBLICIZE ITS VOTER
   20  REGISTRATION SERVICES PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION SEVEN OF THIS SECTION, AND
   21  SHALL  OFFER  TO COLLECT AND TRANSMIT COMPLETED VOTER REGISTRATION FORMS

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00647-02-1

       S. 542                              2

    1  FROM STUDENTS TO THE LOCAL BOARD OF ELECTIONS PURSUANT  TO  SUBDIVISIONS
    2  TWO, THREE, FIVE, NINE, ELEVEN, TWELVE AND FIFTEEN OF THIS SECTION.
    3    ANY COLLEGE, UNIVERSITY OR SCHOOL DISTRICT MAY ELECT TO SOLICIT ONE OR
    4  MORE  RECOGNIZED  NON-PARTISAN  CAMPUS  BASED  ORGANIZATIONS  OR STUDENT
    5  GROUPS TO ASSIST IN ITS EFFORTS TO OFFER PERSONAL ASSISTANCE, COLLECTION
    6  AND TRANSMITTAL OF VOTER REGISTRATION FORMS.
    7    IN ADDITION TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF SUBDIVISIONS TWO, FIVE AND EIGHT OF
    8  THIS SECTION, ALL COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES OFFERING VOTER  REGISTRATION
    9  SERVICES SHALL INFORM STUDENTS OF THEIR RIGHT TO COMPLETE A VOTER REGIS-
   10  TRATION  FORM  FROM  THEIR  COLLEGE OR PREVIOUS ADDRESS; INFORM STUDENTS
   11  THAT THEIR DECISION TO REGISTER OR DECLINE TO  REGISTER  TO  VOTE  SHALL
   12  HAVE NO BEARING ON THEIR COLLEGE OR UNIVERSITY RECORD; AND NOTWITHSTAND-
   13  ING  THE  PROVISIONS  OF  SUBDIVISION  NINE  OF  THIS SECTION, SHALL NOT
   14  INQUIRE OR KEEP RECORDS PERTAINING TO ANY STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY TO VOTE.
   15    IN ADDITION TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF SUBDIVISION SEVEN OF THIS  SECTION,
   16  ALL  COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES AND SCHOOL DISTRICTS SHALL PLACE A PROMINENT
   17  LINK ON THEIR INTERNET HOMEPAGE TO THE APPROPRIATE PAGE OF THE  INTERNET
   18  WEBSITE  OF  THE STATE BOARD OF ELECTIONS FOR INDIVIDUALS TO LEARN ABOUT
   19  THE QUALIFICATIONS TO VOTE, AND TO DOWNLOAD A VOTER  REGISTRATION  FORM,
   20  EXCEPT  THAT  FOR  COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES IN THE CITY OF NEW YORK AND
   21  FOR THE CITY SCHOOL DISTRICT OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK SUCH LINK SHALL  BE
   22  TO  THE  APPROPRIATE  PAGE  OF THE INTERNET WEBSITE OF THE NEW YORK CITY
   23  BOARD OF ELECTIONS.
   24    THE STATE BOARD OF ELECTIONS AND, IN THE CITY OF  NEW  YORK,  THE  NEW
   25  YORK  CITY  BOARD  OF  ELECTIONS  SHALL OFFER COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES AND
   26  SCHOOL DISTRICTS THE OPPORTUNITY TO USE CODED VOTER REGISTRATION  APPLI-
   27  CATIONS THAT IDENTIFY EACH SUCH APPLICATION AS ORIGINATING FROM EITHER A
   28  COLLEGE,  UNIVERSITY  OR PUBLIC HIGH SCHOOL. IF A COLLEGE, UNIVERSITY OR
   29  SCHOOL DISTRICT ELECTS TO USE CODED VOTER REGISTRATION APPLICATIONS,  IT
   30  SHALL  BE  EXEMPT  FROM  ALL REPORTING REQUIREMENTS OF THIS SECTION. THE
   31  STATE BOARD OF ELECTIONS SHALL MAKE AVAILABLE AND PROVIDE FOR THE DELIV-
   32  ERY OF SUCH CODED APPLICATIONS TO  ANY  COLLEGE,  UNIVERSITY  OR  SCHOOL
   33  DISTRICT WITHIN THE STATE WHICH SUBMITS A REQUEST THEREFOR.
   34    EVERY  BOARD  OF  ELECTIONS  SCANNING  VOTER  REGISTRATION FORMS SHALL
   35  CAPTURE ANY DESIGNATED AGENCY CODES THEREON AND REPORT THEM ON A MONTHLY
   36  BASIS TO THE STATE BOARD OF ELECTIONS.
   37    S 2. The opening paragraph of section 5-211 of the  election  law,  as
   38  amended  by  chapter  200  of  the  laws  of 1996, is amended to read as
   39  follows:
   40    Each agency designated as a participating agency under the  provisions
   41  of  this  section,  AND  COLLEGE,  UNIVERSITY AND SCHOOL DISTRICT, shall
   42  implement and administer a program of distribution of voter registration
   43  forms pursuant to the provisions of this section. The following  offices
   44  which  provide  public  assistance  and/or provide state funded programs
   45  primarily engaged in providing services to persons with disabilities are
   46  hereby designated as voter registration agencies:    designated  as  the
   47  state  agencies  which  provide  public assistance are the department of
   48  [social services] FAMILY ASSISTANCE and the department of health.   Also
   49  designated  as  public  assistance  agencies  are  all agencies of local
   50  government that provide such assistance. Designated  as  state  agencies
   51  that  provide programs primarily engaged in providing services to people
   52  with disabilities are the department of labor,  office  for  the  aging,
   53  division  of veterans' affairs, office of mental health, office of voca-
   54  tional and  educational  services  for  individuals  with  disabilities,
   55  commission  on  quality  of  care  for the mentally disabled, office [of
   56  mental retardation and]  FOR  PEOPLE  WITH  developmental  disabilities,

       S. 542                              3

    1  commission  for the blind and visually handicapped, office of alcoholism
    2  and substance abuse services, the office of the advocate for  the  disa-
    3  bled  and all offices which administer programs established or funded by
    4  such  agencies.  Additional state agencies designated as voter registra-
    5  tion offices are the department of state and the  division  of  workers'
    6  compensation.  Such  agencies shall be required to offer voter registra-
    7  tion forms to persons upon initial application for services, renewal  or
    8  recertification  for  services  and  change  of address relating to such
    9  services. Such agencies shall also be responsible for providing  assist-
   10  ance to applicants in completing voter registration forms, receiving and
   11  transmitting the completed application form from all applicants who wish
   12  to have such form transmitted to the appropriate board of elections. The
   13  state  board  of  elections  shall, together with representatives of the
   14  department of defense, develop and implement  procedures  for  including
   15  recruitment  offices  of  the armed forces of the United States as voter
   16  registration offices when such offices are so designated by federal law.
   17  The state board shall also make request of the United States Immigration
   18  and Naturalization Service to include applications for  registration  by
   19  mail  with  any  materials which are given to new citizens.  [All insti-
   20  tutions of the state university of New York and the city  university  of
   21  New York, shall, at the beginning of the school year, and again in Janu-
   22  ary  of  a  year  in  which  the president of the United States is to be
   23  elected, provide an application for registration to each student in each
   24  such institution.] The state board  of  elections  may,  by  regulation,
   25  grant  a  waiver  from any or all of the requirements of this section to
   26  any office or program  of  an  agency,  COLLEGE,  UNIVERSITY  OR  SCHOOL
   27  DISTRICT,  if  it  determines that it is not feasible for such office or
   28  program to administer such requirement.
   29    S 3. The opening paragraph of subdivision 8 of section  5-211  of  the
   30  election  law, as amended by chapter 659 of the laws of 1994, is amended
   31  to read as follows:
   32    Each participating agency, department, division or office  that  makes
   33  available  voter registration forms pursuant to this section shall offer
   34  with each application for the services or  assistance  of  such  agency,
   35  department, division or office and with each recertification, renewal or
   36  change  of address form relating to such service or assistance, a regis-
   37  tration form together  with  instructions  relating  to  eligibility  to
   38  register and for completing the form, except that COLLEGES, UNIVERSITIES
   39  AND  SCHOOL  DISTRICTS  SHALL  DISTRIBUTE  VOTER  REGISTRATION  FORMS IN
   40  ACCORDANCE WITH SUBDIVISION EIGHTEEN OF THIS SECTION, AND forms used  by
   41  the  department  of  [social services] FAMILY ASSISTANCE for the initial
   42  application for services, renewal or recertification  for  services  and
   43  change of address relating to such services shall physically incorporate
   44  a  voter  registration  application  in a fashion that permits the voter
   45  registration portion of the agency form to be detached  therefrom.  Such
   46  voter  registration  application  shall  be designed so as to ensure the
   47  confidentiality of the source of the  application.    Included  on  each
   48  participating  agency's  application  for services or assistance or on a
   49  separate form shall be:
   50    S 4. Paragraph (g) of subdivision 5 of section 5-210 of  the  election
   51  law,  as  amended by chapter 179 of the laws of 2005, is amended to read
   52  as follows:
   53    (g) Notice that the applicant must be a citizen of the United  States,
   54  is [or will be at least eighteen years old not later than December thir-
   55  ty-first  of  the  calendar  year in which he or she registers] AT LEAST

       S. 542                              4

    1  SEVENTEEN YEARS OLD WHEN HE OR SHE SUBMITS AN APPLICATION TO REGISTER TO
    2  VOTE and a resident of the county or city to which application is made.
    3    S  5. This act shall take effect July 1, 2011; provided, however, that
    4  the provisions of this act shall only apply to school districts  on  and
    5  after July 1, 2012.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to voter registration and enrollment
